# Read in the three datasets
```{r}
set.seed(1994)
df_4 <- fread('../raw_data/bioheart_ct_cytof_data_b4_mg.csv',
              nThread = 7) %>%
  as.data.frame()
# %>%
# 
#   group_by(sample_id) %>%
#   slice_sample(n = 5000)

df_4 <- df_4[which(df_4$mg_cell_type_distinct != ""), ]
```

```{r}
colnames(df_4) <- dplyr::recode(colnames(df_4),
                                            'CyTOF.Batch' = 'batch'
                                            )
```

```{r}
df_4[, useMarkers] <- cyCombine::transform_asinh(df_4[, useMarkers], 
                                                 markers = useMarkers)
```


```{r}
df_4_corrected <- df_4 %>%
  batch_correct(markers = useMarkers,
                norm_method = "scale", # "rank" is recommended when combining data with heavy batch effects
                rlen = 10 # Consider a larger value, if results are not convincing (e.g. 100)
                )
```

```{r}
sce <- SingleCellExperiment(assays = list(counts = t(df_4[, useMarkers]),
                                          corrected = t(df_4_corrected[, useMarkers])
),
colData = df_4 %>% dplyr::select(-useMarkers))
```

```{r, eval=F}
set.seed(1994)
sample_pts <- sample(nrow(df_4), 100000)
sce_sub <- sce[, sample_pts]

sce_sub <- scater::runUMAP(sce_sub,
                         subset_row = useMarkers,
                         exprs_values = "counts",
                         BPPARAM = BPPARAM, 
                         n_threads = 7,
                         metric = 'cosine',
                         verbose = T)

df_raw_umap <- reducedDim(sce_sub, 'UMAP') %>%
    as.data.frame()
colnames(df_raw_umap) <- c('UMAP 1', 'UMAP 2')

df_raw_umap$Batch <- sce_sub$batch

# df_raw_umap$Study <- if_else(df_raw_umap$batch %like% '3', '3', '4')
```


```{r, eval=F}
sce_sub <- scater::runUMAP(sce_sub,

                         BPPARAM = BPPARAM,

                         verbose = T)

df_corrected_umap <- reducedDim(sce_sub, 'UMAP') %>%

df_corrected_umap$Batch <- sce_sub$batch
```

### Use FuseSOM to cluster the normalised data
```{r}
# run FuseSOM clustering
nclust = 12
sce$clusters_scMerge2 <- NULL
sce <- runFuseSOM(sce, numClusters = nclust, assay = 'corrected',
                       verbose = FALSE, clusterCol = "clusters_cyCombine")
```

## Perform classification using the scMerge2 clusters
```{r, eval=FALSE}
data <- getProp(sce,
                feature = "clusters_cyCombine", imageID = "sample_id", logit = F)

dat_prop <- data
data <- 2*asin(sqrt(data))

clinicaldata <- colData(sce) %>%
  as.data.frame() %>%
  dplyr::select(sample_id, Gensini, Gender, Age) %>%
  distinct()
clinicaldata$Gensini_bin <- factor(if_else(clinicaldata$Gensini > 0, 1, 0))

encoded_gender <- model.matrix(~Gender-1, data=clinicaldata)
clinicaldata <- cbind(clinicaldata, encoded_gender)

row_names <- rownames(data)

Age <- clinicaldata[match(row_names,clinicaldata$sample_id),
                                      "Age"]
GenderM <- clinicaldata[match(row_names,clinicaldata$sample_id),
                                      c("GenderM")]

clinicaldata_info <- cbind(Age, GenderM)

condition <- factor(clinicaldata[match(row_names,clinicaldata$sample_id),
                                      "Gensini_bin"])


data_logit <- getProp(sce,
                feature = "clusters_cyCombine", imageID = "sample_id", logit = T)
colnames(data_logit) <- paste0(colnames(data_logit), "_logit")
colnames(data) <- paste0(colnames(data), "_prop")
colnames(dat_prop) <- colnames(data)
```

```{r, eval=FALSE}
t <- df_4_corrected
t$sample_id <- df_4_corrected$sample_id

data_mean <- t %>% 
  dplyr::group_by(sample_id) %>%
  dplyr::summarise_at(vars(useMarkers), mean) %>%
  dplyr::select(-sample_id) %>%
  as.data.frame()

data_median <- t %>% 
  group_by(sample_id) %>%
  summarise_at(vars(useMarkers), median) %>%
  dplyr::select(-sample_id) %>%
  as.data.frame()

rownames(data_mean) <- clinicaldata$sample_id
rownames(data_median) <- clinicaldata$sample_id
colnames(data_mean) <- paste0(colnames(data_mean), "_mean")
colnames(data_median) <- paste0(colnames(data_median), "_median")
```


```{r, eval=FALSE}
res.cv <- KFoldCustomEnsemble(dat_prop = data, dat_logit = data_logit, 
                              dat_mean = data_mean,
                              train_y = condition, 
                              nRepeats = 10, k = 10, alpha = 0.2)
```

```{r, eval=FALSE}
aucs <- data.frame(cyCombine = res.cv$cv_res)
write.csv(aucs, file = '../auc_data/cyCombine_study_4_auc.csv', row.names = F)
```

# Look at batch correction performance
```{r, eval=FALSE}
labels <- df_4_corrected %>%
          cyCombine::create_som(rlen = 10,
                                xdim = 8,
                                ydim = 8,
                                markers = useMarkers)

# Add labels
df_4_corrected <- df_4_corrected %>%
  dplyr::mutate(som = labels)
df_4_corrected$id <- 1:nrow(df_4_corrected)
df_4_corrected$batch <- df_4$CyTOF.Batch


# Transfer labels to uncorrected data
df_4$id <- 1:nrow(df_4_corrected)
df_4 <- df_4_corrected %>%
  dplyr::select('id', all_of('som')) %>%
  dplyr::left_join(df_4, by = "id")

df_4_corrected$batch <- df_4$batch
```

## Look at Median Absolute Deviation (MAD) score
```{r, eval=F}
mad_val <- df_4 %>%
      cyCombine::evaluate_mad(df_4_corrected,
                              filter_limit = NULL,
                              markers = useMarkers,
                              cell_col = 'som')

mad_dat <- mad_val$mad
```
## Generate density plot for batch correction
```{r, eval=FALSE}
pdf(file = "../Plots/cyCombine_MAD_plot.pdf",   # The directory you want to save the file in
    width = 6, # The width of the plot in inches
    height = 4) # The height of the plot in inches
mad_dat %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Difference)) + 
  geom_histogram(bins = 30) +
  ggtitle('Histogram of MAD scores for cyCombine', 
          subtitle = paste('Median score:', mad_val$score)) +
  theme_bw() + 
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(size = 12),
        plot.title = element_text(size = 15, hjust = 0.5,
                                  face = 'bold'),
        plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 15, 
                                     hjust = 0.5, colour = 'blue'),
        axis.text.y = element_text(size = 12),
        axis.title.y = element_text(size = 12),
        axis.title.x = element_text(size = 12),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 12),
        legend.title = element_text(size = 12)
        )
dev.off()
```
